definition: to blow up/to destroy with explosives
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: after World Trade Center was knocked down.
sentences.chinese: 在世贸中心被炸毁以后。

sentences.english: Enemy agents plotted to blow up the plant.
sentences.chinese: 敌人奸细密谋炸毁那家工厂。

sentences.english: Here, a woman sifts sand in bombed out Berlin in 1948.
sentences.chinese: 图为1948年一女性在被炸毁的柏林筛沙。

sentences.english: It has also destroyed the cooling tower at its reactor at Yongbyon.
sentences.chinese: 北韩还炸毁了宁边核反应堆的冷却塔。

sentences.english: The bridge went up with a roar when the mine was exploded.
sentences.chinese: 地雷爆炸时，那座桥轰然一声被炸毁了。

sentences.english: Suspects accused of trying to carry out a bomb plot against New Yorks appeared in court.
sentences.chinese: 被指控密谋试图炸毁纽约犹太教堂的疑犯出席听证会。

sentences.english: The bomb blew all the windows out.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹把所有窗门都炸毁了。

sentences.english: The building is blown up finally, and skeleton person reduces drop big then.
sentences.chinese: 房屋最终被炸毁，而骷髅人接着大开杀戒。

sentences.english: They planned to take out the enemy arsenal by bombing it.
sentences.chinese: 他们计划炸毁敌兵工厂。

sentences.english: The insurgents blow up railway tracks, seize land and chase away forest guards.
sentences.chinese: 起义者炸毁了铁轨，夺去了土地，赶走了森林警卫。

sentences.english: His plans, however, came to a halt after the destruction of the first Death Star.
sentences.chinese: 然而，第一颗死星被炸毁后，他的计划就搁浅了。

sentences.english: The Defense Administry said the attacks office was destroyed, at least 42 people injured.
sentences.chinese: 国防部长说一个税务所被炸毁，至少42人受伤。

sentences.english: Zhang Qishan command zhang adjutant laying such as explosives, blow up mine.
sentences.chinese: 张启山命令张副官等铺设炸药，炸毁矿洞。

sentences.english: Our army destroyed the enemy's blockhouse with a rocket bomb.
sentences.chinese: 我军利用火箭弹炸毁了敌军的碉堡。

definition: to level/to raze to the ground
to blow up (demolish with an explosion)
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
